question: Indian Muslims were allotted reserved seats in the Municipal and District Boards, in the Provincial Councils and in the Imperial Legislature, in which of the following acts?
explanation: A Morley-Minto Reform is also known as the Indian Council Act of 1909. Indian Muslims were allotted reserved seats in the Municipal and District Boards, Provincial Councils and Imperial Legislature. Lord Minto is known as the Father of Communal Electorate in India.
